moves.1. e4: I start with the king's pawn opening like I always do.
moves.2. d4: I will bring my other pawn out
moves.2... d5: She brings queens pawn out protected by his king pawn.
moves.3... Qd7: She brings his queen out. I have no idea why.
moves.5. Bb5: I develop my bishop pinning his queen.
moves.5... c6: She blocks it with her pawn.
moves.6... Qg4: She goes looking for a queen trade.
moves.7. Qxg4: I take because its still tied.
moves.7... Bxg4: She takes back with his bishop.
moves.10... Rd8: She moves her rook to d8. I have know idea why.
moves.11. Nf4: I bring my knight out to attack him.
moves.11... Nb4: I don't know why she did that.
moves.14... Re6: She blocks with his rook which is protected.
moves.15. Nf6+: She will probably take me with her knight.
moves.16. Nxg8+: I take advantage of that move with a double check!
moves.17. Rxe6+: Since I am winning I'll take the rook trade.
moves.17... fxe6: She takes back with her pawn.
moves.18... Ke7: She moves her king to the same spot.
moves.19... Kd6: Shes just getting her king even more out of position.
moves.21. Nxg6: I bring my knight to safety.
moves.21... Rg8: I don't know what to do
moves.22. Be7+: I find a pretty good move.
moves.23. Rd1: I bring my rook over to attack the knight.
moves.23... Nxb2: She brings her knight to safety also attacking my rook.
moves.24. Re1: I get my rook out of the way.
moves.25. Bc5: I bring my bishop out of the way of attack also attacking her a7 pawn.
moves.26... Nd2: Not quite sure why she did that.
moves.28... Rg5: Don't know why she did that.
moves.29. Na4: I'm trying to get my knight into the battle.
moves.29... Nd2: Her knight is trying to help.
moves.30... Kd6: It's already protected by the pawn.
moves.31... Ne4: And she brings it back again.
moves.33... Rf5: She moves it over and attacks my pawn.
moves.34. Bc5+: I'm just trying to save time.
moves.34... Kd5: Their both protecting each other so their safe.
moves.35. g3: Time to get those pawns out.
moves.35... Rh5: She comes to go pawn shopping.
moves.37... Rh8: She moves it aaaaalllllllllll the way back.
moves.40. Re1: I block it with my rook.
moves.41... Ke4: She moves her king even farther down the board.
moves.42... Kxf5: But I'll say to that pawn.
moves.43... Kf6: She moves out of the way.
moves.44. Rc5: I start looking at the last pawn.
moves.45... Kf5: Her king is trying to escape.
moves.46... Kf4: She moves her queen down again.
moves.47... Kf3: She moves her king down AGAIN.
moves.49... Kg5: And she moves it up again.
moves.53... Kg7: She surprisingly moves her king to the right instead of attacking the bishop.
moves.59... Kf8: I have to move the bishop.
moves.60. Bh4: I move it all the way down.
